text:
Came on a Saturday for lunch before going to the Lion King.  Got in right after a large group on the patio outside and before another large group was arriving.  Probably 1 of only 2 parties eaching inside (2-4 people).  Place was pretty empty.

Service was good.  Bread/crackers good.  Water stayed full.  We ordered a burger, an asian chicken dish (good, but nothing too special), bbq chicken pita (decent, with homemade potato chips, again, nothing special), and crab cakes (appetizer, came with 5 about the size of golf balls, again, decent).  I had the burger and it was quite tasty.  Came with cheese (said gouda but I got cheddar, without knowing it), (awesome) bacon, tomato (salsa-like, nice touch), and a garlic aeole (couldn't taste).  Very tasty burger- would definitely get this again.  Got a really nice side of fruit with berries and mango.

Menu is mostly sandwiches/burgers, with a couple of asian dishes and some salads.  Kind of random I thought.  Great spot for a quite, though slightly spendy, lunch outing.  Total was around $70 (tip included) for the above mentioned items.

I have been here a few times and none of my experiences have been mind-blowing but this time I was the most disappointed. I ordered the mushroom soup which was very oily and bland knowing that I had enjoyed the chicken chowder the last time made my mushroom soup all the more disappointing. For a main course I had the salmon and was again disappointed. The potatoes were fine, the green beans great and I really enjoyed the maple sauce it is served with but the salmon was dry and way over-cooked. 
The staff is always on-point and you never have to worry about your glass going empty but for me the food is just not worth the price.

This is a great lunch spot, especially if you want to get away from the mega-resorts for a while but not have to travel far.  I stay at THE Hotel often and Cili is nearby.  If someone did not tell me about it, I would never have tried it on my own.  It is located in the club house of Bali Hai golf course just past the Mandalay on the Strip.

I believe it is connected with Wolfgang Puck, or had been in the past. In any event, the lunch menu is extensive, with a varied selection and well executed. Salads, burgers, soups, fish entres are all excellent. The setting is relaxed but not too informal.  Even though it is connected to a golf course, it does not feel like a golf club restaurant.

Cili at Bali Hai was nothing less than first class at our wedding reception we recently had there. We were treated as a queen and king that day and everything went smoothly. Angel had every "t" crossed and "i" dotted leading up to and on that day. I was the type of bride that was somewhat indecisive, especially on the little things (napkin colors, linens, etc). I showed Angel a few pictures on pinterest and he went above and beyond any expectations I ever had. We had about 185 people attend our wedding. The staff was quick to cater to everyone in a timely manner, which was so important to us. Every one of our guests felt special and a part of the big day. They all commented on how delicious the food was (which is/was spectacular), the cake was absolutely stunning and the flowers, entertainment and staff were amazing. We couldn't of had a more perfect day!!

Words cannot express how happy I am that I chose Cili to be the venue for my wedding reception! From the beginning of the planning process to the end- the entire Cili staff were so incredible to work with. Sarah, Babette, and the whole staff took genuine interest and care of us. Cili is not one of those wedding factories that turns and burns weddings and forgets about you the next day- they took such investment in my wedding and it showed. I am beyond appreciative to the staff- as their friendliness, service, and attention to detail were top notch! I had around 200 (most out of town) guests who were absolutely raving about Cili! They truly had an experience that they will never forget- and of course the food was delicious!  If you are looking for a tropical paradise on the Las Vegas strip- look no further! Cili is the place to be! I cannot imagine my reception at any other place! 
Thank you so much Cili and the Bali Hai for making my special day truly magical!

The review from kristine t regarding the child that was out of control on sunday was so elaborated. We were also there and in no way did it ruin our lunch. If you cant handle a child that may misbehave for a bit then maybe you shouldn't go out in public! Our server was perfect, which was the same server you had, and the parents did settle the child down.  The service and food is always great! 

WS

Start to Finish this place is all around amazing!! The driveway into the golf club, valet, the foyer, decor, ambiance, dinning room and the breath taking views!! Just absolutely spectacular. But it doesn't stop there! The staff is friendly and attentive. We had the tomato soup, crab cakes and shared the Cili burger. The food is flavorful and definitely shareable portions. I would definitely recommend this place. If available sit outside and take in the view while enjoying your meal

Such a BEAUTIFUL resort. The perfect place to have a wedding and reception. Great food, excellent service, pretty view --from the sidewalk to the front door, class d√©cor -- and (most importantly) ice cold cocktails. Can't wait to go back!

An Oasis in the middle of the desert...right on the strip!

Unfortunately, the food was just okay....the prime rib was too well done and chewey.  But the ravioli was yummy.

The service was top-notch adn the alchohol was flowing fast.  Something odd though.  Apparently they couldn't bring straight shots to the table.  Everything had to be on ice.  Which makes it a little more cumbersome to take a shot.  So after about 5 of those, we moved the party to the bar...where we could get a straight shot!
This place has amazing food and great service.  The fish and chips are great and the lobster cobb salad is the best ever.

Had a business lunch here today.  The atmosphere, and service were excellent.  The menu had quite a few appetizing items to choose from.  I ended up giving the fish & chips a try.  The fish was delicious, and the batter was nice & light.  I loved the remoulade that was served with the fish, although I lean towards malt vinegar mostly.  I was, however, a little disappointed with the bar quality fries/chips.  There were 3 small fillets of breaded fish next to a heaping mound of skinny, overly cooked fries.  Somewhere beneath the mound of starch lay a few tempura green beans and a small side of a tasty Asian style slaw.  I would have opted for the 2 vegetable sides and not fries if I had the foresight.

Overall, a nice lunch.  I would definitely recommend this for business luncheons or casual upscale dinner with friends.

Went for lunch. It's really close to work and the view is great. 
They have the best iced tea around. I believe I had three glasses of it but it was hard to tell as the wait staff kept it full after a couple sips. 

I had the patty melt with fruit. Ordered it well done, but it came out medium to medium well. Some chefs just have difficulty cooking it well done I guess. The fruit was fresh and not full of honeydew. 

This is a great place to go that's on the strip,but has upfront parking so it's quick and easy to get in and out.

Dear Yelp, we will take out the names of the creepy server and the managers who offered us lunch in the other room where the creepy server "couldn't see us" if we came in for lunch as restitution. Beyond that, going through the effort of finding names off a private list, searching the Internet, possibly finding our address... Can't say it's related, but can't say it's not with those decisions. Also it would be foolish to believe we are the first and only women he's tried to contact outside of the scope of his role as a banquet server - we never exchanged words besides "Diet Coke please."

I guess we could say he was "innocently not stalking, but intensely searching (because we can't say stalking) an attorney. So please.

This is based on a Wedding Reception that I was assisting on:

Two of my dearest friends were getting married and having their wedding and reception at Cili, which is on the Bali Hai Golf Course.
This place is beautiful. The atmosphere boasted an array of multi South East Asian designs combined with today's deco(r) of stressed stone, steel, woods, and hand crafted glass.
Cili seemed to spend a good deal of money on their floral arrangements, filling the restaurant with various orchids, and other exotic flowers and plants that give you the feel of being in the tropics. They also have a few paintings of images of Hawai'i. 
The staff is great. The floor manager was quick to assess and respond to the last minute changes we had. The staff worked very hard and quickly to set up the place; making it beautiful and elegant. 
While the bridal party was out taking pre-wedding photos, Cili's floor manager had sent to the bridal room,(where the Event manager and myself were using as our staging area), h'ors devours ; of fresh fruit, vegetables and cheeses, some fusion sushi, and fresh salsa with house made tortilla chips and crackers. They were delicious. I almost couldn't't stop eating, but I had to remind myself about dinner. Along with this, they made sure we always had a full bottle of San Pellegrino flat and soda water, plus a bottle of Champagne. I had a massive hang-over from the festivities the previous night, so I failed to get the name on the bottle. They brought some beer, wine, sodas, and other alcohol beverages to the wedding party and the people involved with the behind-the-scenes operations of this event.
After the wedding ceremony the guest were all escorted to a designated area, where they were served with cocktail and h'ors devours. This was out side of the restaurant, which was surrounded by a moat and the 9th and 18th hole of the course (I was earlier informed). I was able to witness the of the service staff here. They were professional, friendly and cordial. They were making it easy for everyone of the guest to enjoy the blissful event.
The entire course was designed as 18 single oasis's combined with paths to one another. The fees of the course start at about $375.00. This is a Pro-grade course.
While everyone was being escorted to theirs seats by the event-staff, the servers were making sure every one had drinks. One of my favorite things at a wedding reception is the open-bar! What makes it even better is that some one else is bringing you your drink.
The dinner was a buffet set up. Which, I always find it a thousand times better than a prefixed plate. Not only can you taste many different things, but you can eat till you die.

The menu: Spring Mix Salad, various types of steamed and sauteed vegetables, house backed rolls w/ garlic herbed butter, baked and mashed potatoes, baked chicken, salmon in a herbed lemon cream sauce, and my favorite prime rib.
(Now, I have been to 6 wedding in the last year and a half. The is the 2nd best meal I have since the first one in Hawai'i at Orchid's at the Halekulani Hotel.)
So when I say that this seemingly typical menu was far from typical, believe me. The chef and cooks of Cili have taken the common fare to the highest level. The vegetables were fresh and crisp, even the sauteed and steamed one. Nothing was over cooked or mushy. The roll as I have said were house made. The chicken and salmon were moist and delicious, the herbs and spices perfect. The prime rib; The BEST I have had in years!! I had to have another. I went back for a inch+ cut. Topped it with their delicious, spicy horse radish and hot full flavored ajous. Sadly though, my stomach ran out of room, and there was no more for a third cut.
The Cabernet that was being served at the table was great. Full flavored, full bodied, slightly spicy and dry. I could have sworn it was a Rhone. I didn't't get the name, but I did get a second glass. 
Later to be followed with Champagne, a Heineken, Fat Tire Amber, 2 shots of Patron, Corona, and more San Pellegrino. Don't worry!! hiccup, I'm fine!! Brup.
The cake looked wonderful and delicious. I couldn't't summon the will to eat another bite of food. 
Tea and coffee was served to the guest. What ever type of coffee it was, it near perfect. Not too heavy or too light. It really hot the spot after all that food. Which made way for the tequila and beer.
I was  coherent enough to recognize the great service that everyone received, and to notice as we were preparing to leave, the quick smooth disassembly reset-up of the restaurant. "These guys are real pros", I thought to myself.

What a hidden gem this place is! I went for lunch and the patio is beautiful! You overlook a small lake and the golf course. It's a very relaxing and tropical atmosphere. The food was so amazing! I had the Kobe beef sliders as an app and the pan seared sea bass with risotto as an entree which melted in my mouth! The staff is friendly and the pricing is so reasonable for what's on the menu. I will def be coming back many more times to dine here!

great food and ambiance.  hidden gem in vegas for sure.  great place for brunch outdoors with golf course view with family or place to take your boss,visitors, customers for reasonable price meals and great customer service.  been here many times now and 5 star meals everytime

AMAZING. BEAUTIFUL. PERFECT. Got married here last Nov. Best decision I made besides the groom :) Worked with Becky Davis and she was an angel sent from above. So accommodating, helpful, and wonderful. I have no words to thank her for making our wedding day absolutely magical. We booked Cili without ever seeing the venue based on other reviews and pictures but the photos do not do this place justice. It is so beautiful in person. The entire staff was excellent. Minister was great. The food was delicious (get the salmon & asparagus). Cake was gorgeous. DJ was so much fun. The price was very reasonable. We loved it & so did all of our guests. PERFECT! PERFECT! PERFECT! x infinity :D

Situated along South Las Vegas Blvd within the Bali Hai Golf Club, this jewel of a dining location is perfect for an executive lunch meeting during the day.  The staff is always pleasant, and the food it top notch, while not being too top notch of a price.  It almost seems like you can't drop your fork without one of the staff catching it, but they give you plenty of room to talk without even knowing they are there.

The food is not your usual golf club food.  Their Lobster Cobb Salad is always tasty and their bread basket has a diverse selection to help start the meal.   Excellent setting, fantastic food, and great service make this a winner in my book.

We had our wedding there 2 weeks ago & the customer service was impeccable! Angel, Sarah and Tommy went above and beyond to make sure everything went smoothly and to our satisfaction. They were flexible, attentive & easy to work with. I mentioned that I was very nervous right before the ceremony and needed a "shot". Tommy overheard it and had a Tequila shot ready for me right after the ceremony on a tray! I was very impressed by their attention to details. All the guests had a great time and couldn't stop commenting on how awesome the food (especially the Chilean bass--so yummy) & drinks were and how beautiful the wedding was. We highly recommend this venue for weddings and any other events because they know how to do it perfectly!

The restaurant is located at the golf course of Bali Hai. Valet is available for free and you just have to leave a small tips. You see a lot of nice cars around, and many business lunch are held here. Easy to find and easy parking, so I'd give 4 stars out of 5. 

It's located next to Mandalay Bay. The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. Go and check before you go there because sometimes they close for private events. 

I went with my co-worker for lunch and we ordered combo satay and Kobe Sliders from the apptizers menu. My co-worker ordered the lobster and seabass with risotto and Thai salad as recommended by the server. I thought the satay was okay. I like how it's a bit spicy but not too much to burn your mouth. The peanut sauce is lame. I think it's from a jar. The Kobe slider burger was dissapointing. The sauce was way too much and covering the kobe beef taste. My co-worker thinks the lobster seabass is very good. The Thai salad is meh. Too much sauce and taste like soup instead of salad. I'd give 3 stars for the food. 

Service however, is perfect. The host greeted you right away and the server gave us recommendation and information for special of the day. They need to update their website as they are no longer have separate menu for lunch and dinner. Only one menu available. I'd give 4 out of 5 stars. 

Price is expensive for lunch. Starts at $12 for appetizer and about $20-25 for main entree. It is expected since this resturant is located in the golf course so they can upcharge with the right crowd. Nice golf course, it's green and clean. For the price range and food quality you get from ot, I'd give 3 stars out of 5. 

I am not sure if I would come back again. I like the atmoshphere and the service, but the food need some work.

It's been years since I have been here, but I decided to bring my girlfriend to try out the food while she is visiting town this time. The service was a bit slow, waiting over 8 minutes for a server to show up, we thought no one was going to our order, even though a busser got us water and bread service rather quickly. When we did get to order and received the food, it was prepared great and we enjoyed it. My girlfriend had the wedge salad and I had the Cili burger that comes with cheese, bacon, and a fried egg on a brioche bun and I got cucumber salad as the side. The view is great with a water front consisting of a small waterfall overlooking the golf course at Bali Hai. we chose the patio seating that had window panels in place due to the high winds which makes eating easier with a great scenery to relax and enjoy the food..... hopefully next time a server will acknowledge their section a little more consistently.

Played a round of golf and stopped in for lunch on Friday 29 September 2017.  Fish and Chips was the best I've ever had and I've been to a few pubs in London and Ireland.  The fish was halibut with a generous portion, deep fried perfectly!  Great chips, slaw and fried green beans.  The beer was cold and the bartender provided tremendous customer service.  We'll go there again soon.  P.S.  My wife had the Lobster Salad which she said was fabulous!

My husband and I got married here on October 7th. The venue was perfect - our ceremony was outside on the grass, out cocktail hour on the patios and the reception inside. The food was amazing - people couldn't stop talking about how big the shrimp were, how the food stations were so amazing compared to a sit down dinner, and what a variety there was. Angel was the best coordinator - he helped when I had no idea what to do with flowers or centerpieces, and even sourced a special NJ food for our late night food station that we requested! He sat with me for hours to plan and listened to and answered all of my questions. He helped pick out linens and made the best recommendations. He even served us shots on the dance floor! It wouldn't have been amazing without all his help. Overall, the venue was perfect for our 100 ish guests, and we were on the dance floor the entire time!

Much better than my last visit for lunch. 

Was treated here by my family for Mother's Day Brunch... 
Service has always been great, but today the food was great too.. 

You name it, it was on the buffet. Cold salads, Crab claws & boiled shrimp (that's where I made my meal) roasted vegetables, lamb, prime rib and fish.. 

I had the Cream of Mushroom soup again, and this time it had more flavor.. Rich & creamy soup you expect to have... 

Cili is back on my list to take friends to lunch. The buffet, our service and table outside was great!
This is a place that is always good for lunch.  I also must say it is a perfect venue for a nice event.

Everything was amazing! If I had not gone here for a business lunch I would never have thought to go here. We ordered the Bali Hai burger and the French Dip. Everything was flavorful and fresh. Even the fruit bowl was ripe and not all melon. The view from the patio was gorgeous. The only downside was service was very slow. I feel like they were trying to give a fine dining speed, but that is not a great idea at lunch

Cili is a restaurant located on the Bali Hai golf course. The scenery is great in the sunroom dining room. You are able to see the golfers come and go as they take turns teeing off for each respective hole. I was there for a Human Resources event luncheon. The wait staff are very professional and quick to get the table whatever was needed. As for the food, I will say this. It was the most exquisite mass prepared meal I had tasted in a while. The steak was tender but a few degrees away from being over cooked and well done (I like my steaks med-rare). There was only one option for dessert and but they did provide tea and coffee which was a nice surprise. Overall I would enjoy eating here again and trying different stuff on the menus.

I have only ever gone to Cili for lunch and, on a recent trip, I was disappointed to find that they had changed the menu extensively. It is now much more sandwich and salad intensive (the lobster cobb salad and smoked salmon salad are great). And, in the interest of getting more salad intensive, there's a horrible addition in the form of a smoked ahi taco salad, which I had earlier this week. Not only is the taco shell in which this salad arrives oily, but also there's no smoke in the ahi (in fact, it was very overcooked), and, because this salad is so unwieldy, it's pretty impossible to enjoy! The others at my table ordered the blackened chicken pita (average per the eater); the thai chicken salad (which was great but dripping in dressing); and the bali hai burger (great but not a great lunch option). 

Apart from the food, service is great, as are the views of the golf course from where you sit. And, I agree with the other reviewers that it's a pleasant break from the wackiness of the Strip. 

My two cents: Cili -- bring your old menu back, please -- it was SO much better!!

Great place for a business lunch or dinner.   Very classy and great food.  Chef here is very good.  If you need a special place for a date, this is it.  Hidden, forgotten, you could hide away here and live like a king and queen.  The food is stellar, prices fair, views and decor well above average.  The only question is who shall I meet there, and are they paying?   Girls, go, suggest it, have your man pay, he will be fine.  Guys, take a date here, its not that expensive, but its cozy and shes sexy.   Highly recommended.  not 3 star Michelin stuff like further down the strip, but great value for what you get.  4.75 star here, but I will give it 5 since they are consistant and classy! Highly recommended.   For lunch parties, or any party, would be a great place to do some catering events, classy, not cheap, but not expensive either.   Yummy!

I went to this restaurant for Easter Brunch.. The service and hostess staff were very accommodating and professional!!!  My son likes hot Crab and the waiter totally took care if him and all the other requests at our table!! food was great, fantastic selection for all tastebuds.. I would go back to Cili for brunch with my family anytime of the year!!!!
This Las Vegas Local, Chef and Foodie gives it 5 stars!!!! cheers..

I had the extreme fortune to attend an event at this restaurant which is located inside the Bali Hai Golf Club.  I will recommend this place to anybody that is thinking about getting married, having an upscale party or just wants a great place to have lunch or dinner.

Their wait stuff is so friendly and never let my drink get near empty.  They constanly circled the room and asked all guests if there was anything they could do to make the already excellent service better.

The food is amazing!  The hors d'oeuvres were so delicious and even the simple lunch of a blackened chicken caesar salad was the best I have ever had!  Not to mention their wonderful mimosas.

If you step out onto the patio, you can't help but fantasize about how wonderful your own wedding would look against the backdrop of the lake complete with waterfalls and the sprawling green golf course surrounding the area.  Simply put, this place is a must...in every way possible!
The food is good but the prices are ridiculous. My friend and I had a very simple lunch which cost us$62 plus tip.  All we had was one bottle water and one coffee, no cocktails involved.

"Excellent Lunch On The Golf Course"
So I needed a cute spot to meet my friend from high school for lunch! I did some research on YELP and came across this place! I needed something elegant with outdoor seating! I got exactly that and more! This has to be one of the best scenic lunches I've had in a very long time! The customer service is above par! Definitely eat outdoors if the weather permits to do so! Would recommend this place to anybody who likes an elegant fancy style venue!

So I'm here once a month for an event luncheon. Cili does an excellent job of hosting this event. They staff is professional and polite and the food is always satisfying.

I'm almost ashamed to say I've never come on my own to get a meal. Can't say how the prices or menu is as it's always set for us. 

The venue is really nice though. Full bar available which is always a plus. Come by and let me know how it is when you are here just to eat.

A review in one word; impeccable. More?  Incredible, perfection, amazing, beautiful, wonderful, glorious! 

Angel Kroenecke and the entire staff at Cili at Bali Hai truly provided my husband, guests, and I with the best day ever. Angel took my fairly vague ideas about what I wanted and spun it into stunningly beautiful place settings, tables, flowers, and venue. 

The bar was open and plentiful with attentive servers who never let a drink run empty. The food was delicious; many of my guests were foodies and said it was one of the best meals they've had.  

The officiant chosen by Angel was charming and funny; it seemed like he knew us forever. Everyone was in tears. The DJ got the music started and kept everyone pumped the entire reception. 

Did I mention this was the best day of my life? I couldn't have dreamt of a better day, everything went off without a hitch and I didn't have to worry about a thing. 

Cili at Bali Hai is the most amazing venue and I strongly recommend them to you; I know you'll love them!

Best brunch off the strip!  I had the french toast and it is probably the best since I ordered it @ iHOP like 2 years ago!
It is a little pricey, but the ambiance, food, and service is totally worth it! :D
AND, I wouldn't mind having my wedding and/or reception here!
Just breathtaking!

Beautiful beautiful patio seating overlooking the Bali Hai golf course! I loved it especially because it was super nice outside. The wedge salad and beef sliders were delicious! Service was friendly and attentive.

This little gem is tucked away within the Bali Hai Golf Course right off Las Vegas BLVD. Yes, Cili restaurant at Bali Hai Golf Course is open to the public (no worries there). This is one SWEET upscale lunch spot. It's perfect for when you're looking to escape the hustle and bustle of The Strip and still want to enjoy a scenic and elegant view. If weather permits, opt for outdoor seating to soak in the sunshine and greens- It's delightful!   

I've popped by here a handful of times over the past year and a half to enjoy extended lunch with clients. The hostess and servers have  always been very attentive and welcoming. The atmosphere is upscale without being stuffy and the prices are very reasonable considering the venue (see pics of menu). 

I always order their Chicken/Steak Satay for an appetizer for the table - always super fresh and served on skewers stuck in a hunk of pineapple for an artsy presentation. Additionally, I always order their lobster cobb salad- Fresh diced mangos, cherry tomatoes, diced cucumbers, and hearty hunks of lobster. It's super good and you should come here just to gobble one up- YUM! Their desserts and bread basket are great. I've had their cr√®me brulee and fresh seasonal berries with whipped cream (all very nice).  

Final Verdict: Come here for an elegant (yet casual) lunch date or business meeting. It will hit the spot and impress your guests that tag along.

Fantastic Easter Champagne Brunch Buffet! 
$68 Adults included Tax & Gratuity, Kids 5-12yrs $25, under 5yrs Free.
Little expensive but well worth the money and No waiting with advance reservations!
Omelette station, Scrambled Eggs, Eggs Benedict, Roast New Potatoes, Smoked Bacon, Pancakes, Salad & Fruit Station, Soup & Breads, Veggies/Garlic Mashed Potatoes, Jumbo King Crab Legs, Claws, large peeled Shrimp, Rack of Lamb, Seared Chilean Sea Bass, Prime Rib, Honey Baked Ham, Chicken Marsala, Alfredo Pasta & Deserts including large Chocolate covered Strawberries. 
We have enjoyed this Brunch every year.
Awesome atmosphere in outdoor covered patio.
Fantastic, friendly & attentive 1st class service from all employees & managers.
Appears same/similar Brunch Buffet will be available for Mother's Day.

WOW!! If I could give 6 stars I would! On 9/14/13 I had the MOST beautiful wedding/reception thanks to Cili!! 

Did I mention a stress free wedding thanks to Tracy (the catering sales manager) she was such a doll through the whole process!! I would recommend this venue to all of my family & friends for any gathering!!

By the end of my wedding night I felt as if all the staff were practically family.. Everyone up to the general manger made my night wonderful!! Service was great!

The owner of the place I work treated our office to lunch at Cili recently. I had never been and was excited to see the restaurant I had heard such great things about. The first impression did not disappoint! Cili is decorated gorgeously, and we were seated next to an amazing salt water fish tank. 

I decided to split two apps with a coworker, the seared ahi tuna and crab cakes. The tuna came with a delicious cucumber salad and three pieces of delicious, perfectly seared tuna. The 5 crab cakes were small but flavorful. 

Creme brulee was the perfect way to end our meal. The assortment of berries it was served with were all so fresh and very complimentary to the rich dessert. 

The service was top notch. I never had to wait for a refill on my Arnold Palmer, and they even brought out extra fries for another person in our party. 

Cili is absolutely gorgeous, the next time I go I definitely want to sit on the patio and admire the view.

I go to Cili almost monthly for the AMA (American Marketing Association) luncheons. I have to say that this place is always on point with service and food. 

Right when I walk into the semi-private room where the lunch is held, servers always have ice tea or lemonade on trays ready for me as I walk in. But I'm a little difficult so order an Arnold Palmer and the server finds me and gives it to me. Then I find a seat, put my purse down and mingle with other AMA members. 

When the luncheon is ready to start, I go back to my table and the salad is already pre-set. Salads vary from a caprese, to melon salad, to arugula, and more. I'm always impressed by the variety and that it's not always that lettuce salad with yucky creamy dressing. 

Entrees also vary and I've had chicken cordon bleu, short ribs, and other standard lunch entree dishes. There will always be a protein, starch and vege with light sauce. The portions are generous. The meat is cooked properly. I've been on a less meat diet recently and the last time, I opted for the vegetarian dish. I think when people saw what I got, they wanted mine instead of their beef. 

Dessert is presented very well and delicious. From chocolate cakes with raspberry sauce (I devoured that one) to fruit salad with aged balsamic, it's consistently good. 

Besides the wonderful food, the staff is always professional and courteous. As I mentioned, they are there at the beginning with beverages, then during the salad with dressing, in between courses with water and beverage refills, after entree coffee and tea service, basically everything and everywhere. 

It may sound like this is all normal but for luncheon banquet staff to be always on top of it, that means management is fair and treats them well. Kudos to Cili management. I understand that their service reflects on guests coming back and I'm sold. 

Just like another Yelper mentioned, if I ever needed to have a party, I would not hesitate to book here. 

Note: the one less star is because the golf course grounds are looking beat up. Still beautiful though.

4 1/2 stars - solid restaurant to bring your clients for a power lunch. Located at the Bali Hai golf course and they offer valet even at lunch. 

There were four of us and we didn't have reservations for lunch due to it was a last minute choice but were seated immediately. Cili offers American cuisine with Asian influence. My choice - the Seared Chicken Breast, Aged Cherry Balsamic, Crispy Bacon, Watercress, and Mascarpone on a Whole Wheat Roll - Very good and unique tasting. Cili decor is beautiful and the service was outstanding. 

I'd recommend Cili Restaurant if you want to impress your clients or your date.

I stopped by recently for a special event. They were very accommodating with all of us vegetarians by adding extra veggies to our lunch plate.

Oh, and let's talk about the plate. The grub was quite yummy. The sweet potato puree with cranberry reduction was near addictive! The sauteed veggie assortment was also surprisingly delicious. Oh, and the cheesecake made for a great dessert... And would have been perfect if not for the incredibly tough graham cracker crust.

And of course, the ambiance is quite unique. The dining room is exquisite inside and looks out to a gorgeous golf course outside.

I've only been to a few breakfast events here, so that is what I am reviewing. The service is great. The food is very good as well. The view of the golf course is spectacular. So if you want  great service, great food and a great view, give this place a try. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Stopped in after a recommendation from a friend.  All I have to say is WOW!!  Decor is nice as are the views of the golf course.  But when it comes to quality, taste, and price of the food, there is probably nothing in Vegas that can touch it.  

The food was OUTSTANDING and equal to or better than any place charging 2X the price (Note:  I've stayed in 14 different hotels up and down the Strip, 2-3 times a year, for the past 20 years, and have dined in more 3/4/5 star places than I can count).  

The only downsides are 1) you have to drive/Uber/cab there as it is part of the Bali Hai Golf Club (you prob could walk from Mandalay/Delano/Four Seasons), but well worth it, especially if you are on your way in or out of Vegas, and 2) they only serve lunch.  

All in all, a total gem of a find, and one I will definitely be coming back to again.

NOTE: I was very sick the evening I had lunch there. However I cannot say if it was from their kitchen. However I have my doubts for certain reasons.
Having said it had been years since I have eaten here. It used to be once a week for a great power lunch.
The atmosphere is still great. And the service was excellent.
Concerning was that at lunch time they were completely empty.
Our meal though was excellent. We both had the Mushroom soup and two separate fish entries. Again both were really good.
I really great place to have a wonderful meal during the day.

A hidden GEM for great quality food with a relaxing atmosphere and first class service. I have eaten here several times after I went here for an event. The quality of the food is like any fine dining restaurant to include the service. Sitting outside with the water next to the golf course is very relaxing. It is truly hidden off of Las Vegas Blvd near the Welcome to Las Vegas sign. I have had several menu items and today I had the Lobster Cobb salad with tomato soup. Great lunch place....

I have been to Cili's several times over the past 2 years. The banquet meals are wonderful. Service is excellent. BUT, every time I have come just for lunch with friends, the meal has been terrible and this last time was totally uneatable. So disappointed. Venue is lovely and as I said the service is always good. Prices are normal for Vegas. I really want to give a good review but with this last meal I just can't. The whole package should be much better.

++ views! ambiance! service! bread basket! calamari appetizer. 
+ Lobster salad. Slightly bland, but still good & refreshing.

-- Seabass with risotto entree. (So very yucky & disappointing)
-- Mandarin chicken.  I love spice, but this was so spicy that my husband who cannot take much heat couldn't eat a bite, so I traded my entree with him. I couldn't even eat it, it was so incredibly spicy, couldn't even tell if I was  prepared well or not because of the spice!!!!!    Waste of $$$!!!

I went here for lunch with a few of my friends. The area seems very nice and a great view. The restaurant is located inside the golf club at Bali Hai. We order the Kobe sliders, beef and chicken satay, sea bass risotto and Thai chicken salad. I thought the food was okay. Out of the four items I think the chicken and the beef satay tasted the best. The one that is most most disappointing is the Kobe sliders. It was very Bland and dry.

Overall, food is okay, location is nice. The bathroom is very clean even the parking area is easy to locate. I'm not sure if I will come back here for lunch though but I would recommend it for someone who wants to play golf here. I personally don't play golf but the area seems super nice.

Hidden oasis in the middle of the strip. What a gem. Came here for lunch with a group of fine ladies and the experience was wonderful. 

I started the reservation by leaving a voicemail and my call was returned within one business day. A couple days before the lunch, Cili called to confirm. Upon arrival, I didn't see the self-parking but I was told there is actually one. No worries, complimentary valet. Upon entertaining the clubhouse, which connects the restaurant, there was a lounge area that you can just hang out. Exactly what I did since I was early and was waiting for the rest of the party. 

We reserved a table in the patio area and the view was amazing. The patio was enclosed on the day we were there since it was windy but the glass partitions can be opened for a true al fresco dining experience. 

The food was average. Most of us had the lobster Cobb salad ($19). We also had the calamari and satay. Satay was average. Calamari was actually calamari steak so that was different and perfectly cooked. They also have a small vegetarian menu. There is no breakfast menu on Saturday but our server said they do have breakfast on Sunday. 

The service was superb. Our drinks were never empty. I will definitely return. A great place to bring your out-of-towners or meeting up with a business associates for a quiet lunch/coffee.

I was very overwhelmed with trying to plan a Las Vegas wedding while living here in Reno, Nevada. The people with the Cili Restaurant and the Bali Hai Golf Resort were amazing! They went above and beyond to help me and make my wedding everything I hoped for and more! They handled tiny details that I didn't even think about! The food and service were exceptional. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a classy, non "Vegas" wedding!

Will not be disappointed if you book your wedding at Cili Weddings at Bali Hai Golf Club. 

Make sure you request Angel as your wedding coordinator and Vinh as your DJ (Vivinh Events). Definitely is the dream team!

I was sold on my first meeting with Angel. He answered all my questions without any hesitation and wasn't pushy. Definitely could tell he knew exactly what he was doing. After our meeting, he followed up with an email, which assured me that he was the exact type of person I would want as my wedding coordinator.

All of our guest raved on how great the food was! Cupcakes were amazing (wish I could have one now)! All of the staff was attentive. One detail I wish my guests was aware of is that there was a designated waitperson per table, and didn't need to go to the bar for another drink.

Throughout the planning process, (for the most part) Angel was prompt on replying to emails. Like every other Bride, I was impatient and expected a response ASAP (sorry!). In the end, I realized that they have lots of experience in weddings/events and have full-time wedding/event coordinators. Whom have great relationships with vendors who are able to deliver at a moments notice. Angel (and staff) went above and beyond my expectations on all of the details.

Angel - We cannot thank you enough for your help with amazing wedding! AND for secretly taking pictures and video throughout to share with us on Facebook and IG.

Cili is beautiful and luxurious like a little island getaway. I had the Cili burger: featuring picked onions, a half pound beef patty, cheddar cheese, thick cut bacon on a brioche bun. Very delicious indeed, I choose a side of mixed greens salad with a white vinaigrette dressing. I would return to eat or to enjoy the patio and have drinks.

I was there this past Sunday with my husband.  It was a picture perfect day, so we sat outside to enjoy the ambiance.  You know, the gentle breeze, the waterfalls, the scenery...We even spotted Teller (from Penn &Teller).  Then, this kid (probably about 5 years old) began SCREAMING at the top of his lungs.  It was so annoying that Teller even glared over at the parents, and subsequently, very abruptly left.  So then they allowed the child to get up and run around, at which point he fell, and was crying.  I informed the staff of my dismay, and said that we were there to enjoy our lunch, but couldn't because the PARENTS disrespect by allowing their child to scream and run around.  At which point, the staff said, "Well, they're friends of the owner, so there's nothing we can do."  Really?  So, if your friends with the owner, you can RUIN other patrons' experience?  Is that how you operate a business?  We've been there countless times, and it's always perfection.  I'm so disappointed in the manner in which this situation was handled.

OMG; the Chilean Sea Bass was rockin and rollin! The cream bed of rice had veggies and shrimp in it and was very well seasoned and so flavorful with every bite. I also had the tomato basil soup which also had great flavor. The restaurant is on a very high end golf course on the Las Vegas Strip close to the airport, but the food was moderately priced. The service was excellent and the overall ambiance was very comfortable for business or for pleasure. I've tried this restaurant about 3 years ago with a slightly different menu and remember the dish I had was also very nice. Breakfast is also good as I attended an event there that included a round of golf and breakfast. You can't go wrong at Cili...

I was hear earlier this month on a site walkthrough for a clients wedding. Invited to have lunch and drinks at the restaurant and I was pleased. Although being modest, I had the calamari- which was very yummy and prepared well. After not being certain of what type of wine I liked (fruity and sweet) the sweet bartender brought me out several samples until we found one I liked. He even let me linger a bit while I finished some notes and emails. 

Thanks for the amazing service guys and can't wait to work with you for my clients wedding in July!

We came to Cili for a large group event.  The menu was pre-planned, and the food was prepared in bulk.  This review would be more helpful for people planning something like a reception at this restaurant, not so much for people just stopping in for a meal.

The first course was a mixed greens salad with cherry tomatoes, and an assortment of breads served with pineapple butter.  
The salad tasted fine, but the greens were definitely bruised (a commonly occurring phenomenon when someone tries to toss a ridiculously large amount of lettuce in one huge bowl).  The breads were delicious, and the butter wasn't obnoxiously pineapple-flavored.  I still think plain butter would have made more sense.
The second course was a choice of chicken with a cheddar potato cake served with green beans and garlic sauce, or beef with parmesan risotto served with asparagus and a red wine sauce.  
My boyfriend and I split both, and overall they were pretty good.  The worst tasting thing was the chicken.  It was well-seasoned, but way too dry.  Everything else was good, but not really amazing.
Dessert was creme brulee with fresh berries.  I was really excited about it, because I love creme brulee, but this was probably the saddest one I've ever had.  Someone else at the table said that it was more like vanilla pudding, and I absolutely have to agree.  The consistency, and flavor were way off.
Overall, it was a fun dinner, and a good meal.  However, at this price point, I think you could find a restaurant that's more consistent with their preparation of dinners in bulk.  
I would be curious to try this place in normal circumstances.  I'm sure the food would be a lot better without quite so much pressure to crank everything out at the same time.

We hosted my daughter's wedding at Cili in late January and I want to share what a great experience it was, all the way from planning to the wedding itself. It was a top-notch event that met my daughter's hopes and dreams, and garnered glowing comments from our guests.

The setting is gorgeous with the tropical golf course backdrop and patios, and the interior spaces (entry hall, reception/bar area, dining room) are expansive and luxurious. The indoor-outdoor layout can accommodate any weather conditions. The dining room was beautifully appointed with high-end linens and place settings. The floral arrangements were beautiful and a perfect match to my daughter's vision.

Cili provides an all-inclusive service that covered the service, cocktail hour, dinner, and dancing, along with the previously mentioned excellent florist. The food was delicious, beginning with the plentiful appetizer selections picked by the couple, and on to dinner that was on par with any fine dining experience in Las Vegas. The entree selections were raved about by the guests (my sea bass was great!) and the presentation was wonderful. We had a mixed drinking and non-alcohol crowd, but everyone's glass was kept full by the amazing servers. There were plenty of servers both for cocktails as well as dinner and they provided first-class attention while being personable and fun. Also fun was the included DJ, who ensured that special wedding elements (first dance, etc) were conducted and encouraged guest enjoyment in an engaging but not obnoxious manner.

So the event itself was outstanding in every way. But from my perspective, also important was the planning experience. Tracy Horn, the catering sales manager, coordinated the planning and was a joy to work with. She is professional, competent, a great listener, and fun. Tracy was able to accommodate our desires (you have a lot of control over the layout, food, music, flowers, etc) and also suggested and arranged for aspects we would not have thought about. Plus, she personally ensured that everything ran smoothly on the day of the wedding. You can rely on her completely.

Everything about our experience with Cili was positive. Costs were fully and accurately disclosed, and we believe we received excellent value for every dollar spent. It is really astounding that for such a large affair (we rented the entire space and had about 100 guests), I can truly think of no negative at all.

Top-flight operation from beginning to end, with great management and staff, that provided us a perfect wedding to remember forever!

8/16/16- Terrible service from Lynelle.  Slow and inattentive.  Constantly looking for her and asking other personnel to go find her.  Then  I was forced to pay 20% gratuity,- when the service provided deserved no more than 10%.  I brought my clients here for a business luncheon and was embarrassed that I chose Cili for this luncheon.  Calamari was super salty.  Shrimp in Shrimp Tempura tasted bad.  It's a shame that someone doesn't have to provide excellent service because they know they will get 20% gratuity (no matter what type of service is provided),- simply because of the size of the party (which was 8 people).  I will never return to this restaurant again.  The one bright side was the level of service from the car valets.  They were friendly, very welcoming and efficient.

I was here for a private event, so I can not comment on their regular menu or the service on a daily basis.

Cili is located at Bali Hai golf course, almost directly across from the "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign on South Las Vegas Blvd.  It is definitely best to enter the property while heading south on LVB (exit the freeway at Russell Road and turn right), as I came from the opposite direction and traffic was NUTS!  

The restaurant hosted the Southern Nevada Hotel Concierge Association Choice Awards Gala, so they closed down for the private event.  There is valet parking and self parking available.

We entered from the backside of the restaurant, where the patio is located.  It (and the restaurant itself) have an awesome view of the golf course, and the patio also has ceiling fans to help with the heat.  It is glass enclosed, but I am unsure if that space is air conditioned in the sweltering summer months.

There were passed appetizers and drinks during the reception portion of the event.  Some of the appetizers were jumbo shrimp (HUGE), individually served and topped with cocktail sauce.  Also, meatballs on a stiick which were very delicious.  There was also some sort of fried mashed potato thingy, which had a spicy kick to it and were really good.  Lasty, I remember seeing a sausage appetizer, which was also tasty.  There was red/white wine, a great selection of beers (Magic Hat #9), and a really delicious signature drink, which we were told was made with blood orange vodka, grape juice and some other stuff.  It didn't taste like alcohol, which is always dangerous!

This is definitely a perfect place to host a private event or wedding reception.  The set up of the room was great, and there is enough room for a lot of people (there were appx 200 people at this event).  The decor was beautiful and the service was a highlight of the night!

Our dinner was pretty amazing.  The first course was an heirloom tomato and fresh mozarella salad with baby greens, olive oil and balsamic reduction.  I can't believe this was just the start - the portion was huge!  And everything was really good.

The entree was braised boneless beef shortribs with garlic potato puree & seared sea scallop with sauteed swiss chard and blackberry pinot noir sauce.  The meat was pretty much to die for.  It didn't need a knife it was so tender.  The scallop was perfectly cooked and the potatoes and swiss chard were great accompaniments.  I did hear that they offered vegetarian options for those who requested them.

Lastly, dessert!  We were served dark chocolate mousse torte and white chocolate drizzled raspberry cream puff.  I am not a big chocolate eater, so my torte pretty much went untouched, but the cream puff was super delicious!!  It was light and airy and not overly sweet.

As I said previously, the service was the highlight of the evening.  At no point were our drinks even close to empty, and everyone's meals were served about simultaneously.  Everyone I encountered was very friendly and offering help in some way.

I definitely want to come back in the future and try the full menu, and I have a friend getting married next year - you better believe I recommend she have her reception here!

5/11/15 update - I wanted Mrs. C and Baby C to experience Cili, so it was our last meal before heading home.  The patio was really nice & the shrimp cocktail is not to be missed!  The whole chilled shrimp hanging off a wine glass with cocktail sauce in the glass has been done to death.  Cili's version is DELICIOUS with the shrimp sitting on a bed of chilled sushi rice, and it is straight up amazing.  Get this appetizer & thank me later.
__________________________________________

On my way in from Los Angeles, I needed a quick lunch & didn't have time to stop anywhere else.  I really enjoyed my lunch at Cili, but maybe that's because it was the one time out of the year where I guessed correctly on what would be delicious on the menu.

First of the all, the prices at Cili are extremely reasonable.  Most salads & sandwiches are in the $12-$15 range, and I don't think anything on the menu was over $25.  I thought it might be more expensive, given the cost of the golf here, but that was not the case.  I ordered a Mediterranean salad & satay skewers, & both were excellent!  The satay skewers were a mix of beef & chicken, elegantly presented on a cut pineapple with a few vegetables thrown in.  It also came with 2 sauces & I couldn't make up my mind which one tasted better, because both were so dang good.  One was a red curry sauce, and one was a ginger/soy sauce.  Just cut your meat in half & try both.  You can't go wrong.

The Mediterranean salad was also good with a nice mix of greens, feta cheese, olives, tomatoes, etc.  But the one thing that I thought was particularly clever was that the croutons were toasted pieces of pita bread.  Why haven't I seen this in other greek salads?  It's such a great idea!

Four stars for good service & good food that doesn't break the bank.

We have only been for brunch, but it was one of the best spreads I've ever seen.  We used to go to Miralago out at Lake Las Vegas for the ambience and relaxation, but since it closed we have been on the hunt for new places.  Cili delivers, with a large outdoor patio, and top notch staff.

Our Red Hat Ladies group went to lunch here yesterday.  A separate area was set up and waiting for us.  The servers were attentive, efficient and lovely.  The food was Very good and the new menu offered a variety of selections.  Afterwards when leaving my Mom had a dizzy episode and the young men outside were very helpful helping us get her in the car.  We so appreciated this kindness after such a nice lunch experience..  Thanks!
